revised_title: Investigating the Action of Crystallized Bodies on Homogeneous Light
tldr: The author, John F. W. Herschel, examines the interaction of crystallized bodies, such as apophyllite, with homogeneous light. He discovers that the deviation from Newton's scale of colors is due to the secondary cause, which affects the lengths of the minimum oscillations of differently colored rays within the medium. This study helps to understand the properties of crystals and their effects on light.
